Articles.Content:
Hello devs!

I am currently playing KSP v1.0.2, and encountered a weird problem on my Linux machine: If I try to buy certain parts from the VAB menu, I can buy them for one mission, but it resets after one flight. This occurs on the following system version:

user@computername:~$ lsb_release -a

No LSB modules are available.

Distributor ID: Ubuntu

Description: Ubuntu 14.04.2 LTS

Release: 14.04

Codename: trusty

I attached the KSP.log file and the savegame in which I encounter this error. Follow the following recipe to encounter the error:

1) Load the savegame

2) Enter the VAB and

3) Start with a small cockpit (the first one that you get, if that matters)

4) Find the "Structural Fuselage" part and buy it for 2500

5) Add the Structural Fuselage to the ship

6) Press "Launch"/"Go to launch site"

7) Recover the ship

8) Go to the VAB

-> Notice that now one has to rebuy access to the Structural Fuselage

This also happens with one of the large boosters available in the savegame.

- - - Updated - - -

Download the bug related resources from here: http://www.craftware.nl/rebuy-issue.zip

Aaah crap... not a bug from your side but one introduced by me by improperly installing KSP over an old Alpha(Beta?) installation of KSP. This way parts were duplicated and the program did not know which part was unlocked or so... do not quite know why, but the log file actually was very helpful!

Futhermore, another example where structured searching solved the issue :-)

- - - Updated - - -

PS: Can somebody set this to solved or something?
